hero.content:
Rich countries are importing a solution to their nursing shortages—and poor countries are paying the price
qz.com

As US healthcare workers quit in droves, record numbers of migrant nurses from the Philippines and elsewhere are filling the void

qz.com

primary.lead: Floating Barrier By China in Scarborough Shoal
primary.title: PCG: China installs floating barrier southeast of Bajo de Masinloc
primary.description: Manila, Philippines — The Chinese Coast Guard (CCG) has installed a floating barrier southeast of Bajo de Masinloc, also known as Panatag Shoal or Scarborough Shoal, the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) revealed Sunday.

secondary.title: Manila vows to remove barrier placed by China's coast guard at a disputed site
secondary.description: Philippine officials vowed Monday to remove a floating barrier placed by China's coast guard to prevent Filipino fishing boats from entering a disputed lagoon in the South China Sea.

secondary.title: PCG removes China barrier - Manila Standard
secondary.description: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) on Monday removed the floating barriers installed by China at a shoal in the West Philippine Sea that blocked Filipino fishermen from the fish-rich area, following the orders of the President and the direction on National Security Adviser Eduardo Ano.

secondary.title: What is Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea and why are China and the Philippines disputing it?
secondary.description: The Philippines on Tuesday vowed not to back down against a Chinese move to block its fishermen from a hotly contested area of the South China Sea, as Beijing warned against provocations after Manila severed its floating barrier.

carousel.title: ₱125-M OVP confidential funds were spent in just 11 days, not 19, says Quimbo
carousel.description: Quimbo said COA has committed to finish its audit of the ₱125 million by Nov. 15 this year.

carousel.title: For Filipino wartime rape survivors, a last hope for reparations
carousel.description: Women raped by Imperial Japanese soldiers in 1944, UN body calls for reparations from Philippines government, Remaining survivors pin hopes for fund on President Marcos

carousel.title: Marcos okays ₱12.7-B financial aid to rice farmers
carousel.description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has approved and ordered the release of ₱12.7 billion for the Rice Farmers Financial Assistance (RFFA) to help about 2.3 million small rice farmers amid some agricultural challenges in the country, Malacañang announced Saturday.

carousel.title: Hackers demand $300,000 for compromised PhilHealth database
carousel.description: Hackers have asked for $300,000 or roughly P17 million from the government after the database of state insurer PhilHealth was hacked through the Medusa ransomware, according to the Department of Information and Communications Technology.
